gross_exposure.methodology: Trial: Disgorgement $470M-$480M (4-year lookback) + Penalties $80M-$90M (Tier 2) + Prejudgment Interest $70M-$120M. Settlement: 40-60% discount with cooperation credit.

high_severity_findings.mitigation: Prioritize settlement negotiations. Proactively cease staking and delist 20-30 highest-risk tokens. Leverage Ripple programmatic sales precedent and 2024 SEC regulatory shift (Coinbase dismissal, Binance stay).
high_severity_findings.deal_blocking_risk: MEDIUM-HIGH - MAC clause trigger if SEC files enforcement pre-closing

gross_exposure.methodology: 23 NYCRR § 200.8(a) requires $282M minimum capital. CTE has $141M. Shortfall = $141M equity raise required.

high_severity_findings.mitigation: Complete $141M capital raise pre-closing OR structure as bridge financing from acquirer. Filing BitLicense application with demonstrated capital adequacy increases approval probability from 65% to 75-80%.
high_severity_findings.deal_blocking_risk: HIGH - Without capital raise, BitLicense denial risk 35% (loses $67M annual NY revenue)

gross_exposure.methodology: SEC settlement requires delisting 20-30 tokens (base case) to 42 tokens (bear case). 20-30 tokens = 23% of 180 trading pairs × $462M trading revenue = $106M × 50-75% impact = $50M-$75M. NPV at 5× EBITDA multiple.

high_severity_findings.mitigation: No mitigation available. SEC settlement will mandate token delistings. Negotiate to minimize scope (target 20 tokens vs. 42 full list).
high_severity_findings.deal_blocking_risk: MEDIUM - Reduces adjusted EBITDA from $185M to $110M (41% reduction with other losses)

gross_exposure.methodology: CTE's staking program generates $58M annual revenue. Kraken precedent (Feb 2023) established staking constitutes unregistered securities offering. NPV at 5× EBITDA multiple.

high_severity_findings.mitigation: Cease U.S. staking operations immediately to demonstrate good faith remediation. Explore non-custodial staking alternatives or geographic restrictions.
high_severity_findings.deal_blocking_risk: LOW - Unavoidable but quantified revenue loss

gross_exposure.methodology: CFTC requires cessation of 3× leverage margin trading ($28M annual revenue). Additional disgorgement $28M-$33M + penalties $5M-$10M. NPV at 5× EBITDA for revenue loss + one-time settlement.

high_severity_findings.calculation: 0.90 × $38M settlement (one-time penalty/disgorgement). Revenue loss NPV captured separately.
high_severity_findings.mitigation: Negotiate settlement allowing continued margin trading if CTE registers as FCM. FCM registration costs $2M-$5M one-time + $2.15M annual compliance. Alternative: Cease margin trading and accept $42M NPV revenue loss.

high_severity_findings.mitigation: Target settlement at 70% recovery ($26M-$30M). Leverage bad faith exposure ($155M-$163M potential treble damages under Texas law) to pressure insurer. If denied, file declaratory judgment action in Delaware or Texas.
high_severity_findings.deal_blocking_risk: MEDIUM - If full denial, $47M loss = 25% EBITDA reduction

deal_viability_assessment.rationale: Expected value exposure of $989M (55.0% of $1.8B purchase price) falls squarely in the 'RENEGOTIATE PRICE' zone (42-67% threshold per T10 framework). Base case projects 96% EBITDA destruction (from $185M to $6.7M annually) due to revenue losses and ongoing compliance costs. Acquisition uneconomical at $1.8B valuation. Deal viable at $1.2B-$1.4B (22-33% discount) with hybrid escrow/earnout structure.
deal_viability_assessment.deal_blocking_risk_assessment: NO DEAL-BLOCKING ISSUES DETECTED. All high-severity findings (SEC $369M, BitLicense $141M, token delisting $112.5M, staking $87M) are quantifiable and remediable through settlement, capital raise, or operational adjustments. No findings meet thresholds for: (a) regulatory denial likely (>70% probability), (b) criminal exposure, or (c) closing condition failure.
deal_viability_assessment.timeline_feasibility: AT RISK - SEC settlement and BitLicense approval both require 12-18 months each. Original Q2-Q3 2025 closing infeasible. Revised target: Q3 2026 (18 months). Recommend 24-month outside date (Q1 2028) for 6-month buffer.

tornado_chart.description: Largest single driver of exposure variance. Settlement at $240M (bull) vs. trial judgment $565M (bear) creates $325M swing.
10 tokens delisted ($37.5M NPV) vs. all 42 tokens ($150M NPV). SEC settlement negotiations determine scope.
Capital raise approved ($141M) vs. denied with NY market loss ($141M + $110M NPV revenue loss = $251M).
Arbitration enforced ($2M) vs. trial judgment ($80M low-end). 60% probability of arbitration enforcement.
Claim approved ($10M SIR only) vs. denied ($47M full cost). 55-45% split on approval probability.

sensitivity_analysis.key_insight: SEC settlement terms and token delisting scope account for 44% of total exposure variance. These two variables should be primary focus of purchase price negotiation and escrow structuring.
